description: County-to-basin mappings for major U.S. oil and gas basins. This file is user-editable to add or modify basin definitions.

Permian Basin.description: One of the most prolific oil and gas producing regions in the United States, spanning West Texas and Southeast New Mexico

Eagle Ford.description: Major shale oil and gas play in South Texas

Haynesville.description: Major natural gas producing shale formation in East Texas and Northwest Louisiana

Bakken.description: Large oil and gas producing formation in North Dakota and Montana

Marcellus.description: Vast natural gas producing shale formation in the Appalachian Basin

DJ Basin.description: Denver-Julesburg Basin in Colorado and Wyoming

Anadarko Basin.description: Multi-layered sedimentary basin in Oklahoma, Texas, Kansas, and Colorado

Powder River Basin.description: Major coal and oil producing basin in Wyoming and Montana

Utica.description: Natural gas producing shale formation underlying the Marcellus

notes: Counties are listed by their official names as they appear in FracFocus data
Some counties may overlap between basins due to multiple producing formations
This list focuses on major producing counties and is not exhaustive
To add a new basin, follow the same JSON structure with state and county arrays
After modifying this file, restart the analysis to apply changes

usage.add_basin: Add a new basin object under 'basins' with states and counties arrays
usage.add_county: Add county name to the appropriate state array (use exact spelling from FracFocus)
usage.remove_county: Remove county name from the array
usage.modify_description: Update the description field to provide context
